title: U.S. among 17 countries that practice forced labor, a form of ‘modern slavery,’ report finds
description: The 13th Amendment abolished slavery in the United States in 1865, with one exception: compulsory labor in prisons.

title: Russian blogger says he was fired over interview with mercenary boss
description: Konstantin Dolgov, a pro-Kremlin blogger, interviewed the head of the Wagner mercenary group, who said Russia's war had backfired and who warned of revolution.

title: Despite government pledges, migration into U.K. soars
description: Attitudes about migration levels have changed dramatically since the 2016 Brexit vote. It is no longer the salient issue that it once was.

title: Vinícius Júnior, Real Madrid and soccer’s racism scandal, explained
description: Fans chanted racist abuse at Vinícius Júnior during a Real Madrid match in Spain, prompting arrests. It is the latest scandal in a sport long plagued by racism.

title: Zelensky is surprise speaker at Johns Hopkins commencement ceremony
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed Johns Hopkins University graduates during a surprise commencement speech. He also was awarded an honorary degree.

title: India holds G-20 tourism event in restive Kashmir to showcase its normalcy
description: The G-20 meeting in Kashmir shows how India's crackdown has brought stability and new shopping malls, but residents maintain the development does not include them.

title: Tina Turner left a life of pain in the U.S. In Europe, she found home
description: Turner, who eventually relinquished U.S. citizenship, found new levels of fame and happiness in Europe, living in England, France, Germany and Switzerland.

title: Masked man with knife and gun kills three in Japan’s Nagano prefecture
description: The masked man wore sunglasses and camouflage and was armed with a knife and what appeared to be a hunting rifle.

title: Netanyahu passes budget, steadies his rule and eyes judicial change again
description: With the budget passed, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appears to have gained a measure of control of his fractious right-wing coalition.

title: No laughing matter: China cancels comedy, citing ‘force majeure’
description: The sudden cancelation of comedy gigs, including after audience members report jokes to authorities, has some in China worrying about a "Cultural Revolution 2.0."

title: Ukraine live briefing:  F-16 jets will be a strong signal from the world to Russia, Zelensky says
description: Ukraine says its defense system will only be complete with the powerful fighter jets and is working to deploy them as soon as possible.

title: In wartime Russia, a farm-to-table evangelist finds refuge in a village
description: Boris Akimov, Russia's leading locavore, now runs an inn and restaurant in a village and hopes his country might find redemption in farming, foraging and, especially, homemade food.
